Description.Title: Penman (Penman–Monteith evapotranspiration) strategy – EnergyBalance component
Description.Authors: Peter D. Jamieson; Glen S. Francis; Derick R. Wilson; Robert J. Martin
Description.Institution: New Zealand Institute for Crop and Food Research Ltd.
Description.ExtendedDescription: This component implements the Penman–Monteith formulation to estimate daily evapotranspiration when wind/vapour pressure data are available, within the EnergyBalance suite. The algorithm combines a Priestly–Taylor radiative term with an aerodynamic term: ETp = ET_PT/Alpha + 1000 * (rhoAir * cpAir * VPDair * conductance) / (lambdaV * (hslope + psychrometricConstant)). Inputs are evapoTranspirationPriestlyTaylor (from Priestly–Taylor), hslope (slope of the saturation vapour pressure–temperature curve), VPDair (vapour pressure deficit), and boundary layer conductance. Parameters include psychrometricConstant (default 0.66), Alpha (1.5), lambdaV (2.454 MJ kg-1), rhoDensityAir (1.225 kg m-3), and specificHeatCapacityAir (0.00101 MJ kg-1 °C-1). Output is evapoTranspirationPenman in g m-2 d-1.
Description.ShortDescription: Penman–Monteith daily evapotranspiration estimator combining radiative (Priestly–Taylor) and aerodynamic terms.

Input.name: hslope
Input.description: Slope of saturated vapor pressure curve at air temperature

Input.name: lambdaV
Input.description: Latent heat of vaporization of water

Input.name: specificHeatCapacityAir
Input.description: Specific heat capacity of dry air

Function.name: CalculateModel
Function.description: Returns Penman-Monteith evapotranspiration as Priestly-Taylor term divided by Alpha plus an aerodynamic term based on air properties, VPD, conductance, and psychrometric terms.
